<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 808, 558]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 604, 728, 635]]<|/det|>

\[s = ut + \frac{1}{2} at^{2}\] \[\nu^{2} = u^{2} + 2as\]

\[W = \rho \Delta V\]

\[\rho = \rho gh\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 262, 561, 294]]<|/det|>
\[\rho = \frac{1}{3}\frac{Nm}{V}\langle c^2\rangle\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 305, 536, 321]]<|/det|>
\[a = -\omega^2 x\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 339, 615, 375]]<|/det|>
\[\nu = \nu_{0}\cos \omega t\] \[\nu = \pm \omega \sqrt{(\chi_{0}^{2} - \chi^{2})}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 380, 536, 415]]<|/det|>
\[f_{0} = \frac{f_{s}V}{\nu\pm\nu_{s}}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 425, 536, 460]]<|/det|>
\[V = \frac{Q}{4\pi\epsilon_{0}r}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 467, 628, 486]]<|/det|>
\[1 / C = 1 / C_{1} + 1 / C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 500, 596, 520]]<|/det|>
\[C = C_{1} + C_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 529, 526, 556]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[450, 570, 531, 588]]<|/det|>
\[I = A n v q\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 603, 596, 622]]<|/det|>
\[R = R_{1} + R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 637, 628, 655]]<|/det|>
\[1 / R = 1 / R_{1} + 1 / R_{2} + \ldots\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 668, 517, 703]]<|/det|>
\[V_{\mathrm{H}} = \frac{BI}{ntq}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 715, 561, 733]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[445, 777, 536, 812]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 920, 230]]<|/det|>
A beach ball is released from a balcony at the top of a tall building. The ball falls vertically from rest and reaches a constant (terminal) velocity. The gravitational potential energy of the ball decreases by \(60 \text{J}\) as it falls from the balcony to the ground. The ball hits the ground with speed \(16 \text{m s}^{-1}\) and kinetic energy \(23 \text{J}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 241, 180, 260]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 411, 181, 429]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
A microwave receiver is initially placed at position X where it detects an intensity minimum. The receiver is then slowly moved away from X directly towards the plate.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 118, 220, 135]]<|/det|>
<label>1.</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[228, 117, 920, 151]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[494, 210, 920, 228]]<|/det|>
<form>distance = .................................................... m

<label>2.</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[228, 256, 920, 289]]<|/det|>
Determine the number of intensity maxima that are detected by the receiver as it moves from X to a position that is 9.1 cm away from X.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[500, 365, 920, 383]]<|/det|>
<form>number = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A source of sound is attached to a rope and then swung at a constant speed in a horizontal circle, as illustrated in Fig. 5.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 112, 801, 285]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 303, 591, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 5.1 (not to scale)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
The source moves with a speed of \(12.0 \text{m s}^{-1}\) and emits sound of frequency \(951 \text{Hz}\). The speed of the sound in the air is \(330 \text{m s}^{-1}\). An observer, standing a very long distance away from the source, hears the sound.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 397, 146, 415]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 396, 920, 429]]<|/det|>
Calculate the minimum frequency, to three significant figures, of the sound heard by the observer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 583, 920, 600]]<|/det|>
<form>minimum frequency = .................................................. $Hz$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 613, 146, 631]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 613, 591, 631]]<|/det|>
The circular path of the source has a radius of \(2.4 \text{m}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 644, 920, 676]]<|/det|>
